poem:
"Upon Mhairi Fraser's Debut"

In Tory spotlight stands a wren,
more her story than how or when.
Politics – a grim stage, an act,
between Mogg's past and Anderson's fact,
rises this new warrior's flame.
"Margaret Thatcher…" begins her claim.
Questions answered, doubts abate,
in the mould of the Iron Lady, she'll create,
Fraser, Tory force yet unmet,
Stepping forth - her political ballet.
